Talk_1012:
<sp:3:0:2:0400>Oh, why am I still talking? Didn't mean to
keep you out in the wet.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you need a place to dry off, you're
welcome to go inside.

The outbuilding was destroyed, but my
house itself is OK.
Talk_1000:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Scare_01>I wish I could call for help, <sp:5:0:0>but then they'd find me.


Maybe I'll just whisper it as loud as I can...<sp:5:0:0>
Help... <sp:5:0:0>Help... <sp:5:0:0>Heeelp!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_1013:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I have to get that <clr:0000>precious painting <clr:ffff>from
out of the rubble!<sp:0:4:0>But I can't possibly lift this stuff!<sp:5:0:0>
I wonder if <clr:0000>Bolson<clr:ffff> can help...
Talk_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>The main part of my house held up, but
the outbuilding was destroyed.<sp:0:4:0>A <clr:0000>precious painting <clr:ffff>was in there...
I hope it hasn't been damaged.
Talk_1014:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>And now it's raining? One thing
after another...
Talk_1002:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Now, I've got to figure out how to get my
<clr:0000>precious painting <clr:ffff>out of the rubble.<sp:0:4:0>This debris is so heavy though. I'm not
strong enough to move it.<sp:0:4:0>I wonder if <clr:0000>Bolson<clr:ffff> can help...
Talk_1015:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>And now it's late. But why should I go
to sleep? Not as if my luck will be any
better tomorrow...
Talk_1028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hey, sir! You're back! You took a liking to
Lurelin Village, huh?
Talk_1016:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>And now it's morning, and I didn't
get a wink of sleep. When will my luck
turn around...
Talk_1029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hey, sir! Spending the night in
Lurelin Village?
Talk_1017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>No matter how much debris I dug through,
I couldn't find the <clr:0000>precious painting<clr:ffff>.

Honestly, I lost hope it would ever
be recovered.<sp:0:4:0>But Bolson told me that thanks to you,
it was—<sp:5:0:0>and in perfect condition!<sp:0:4:0>Moving rubble, building houses...
Is there anything you can't do?<sp:0:4:0>You know, I'm set to be the head of this
village one day.<sp:0:4:0>And when that happens, I can only hope
I'm as good at solving problems as you!
Talk_1018:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>No matter how much debris I dug through,
I couldn't find the <clr:0000>precious painting<clr:ffff>.

Honestly, I lost hope it would ever
be recovered.<sp:0:4:0>But Bolson told me that thanks to you,
it was—<sp:5:0:0>and in perfect condition!<sp:0:4:0>Moving rubble, building houses...
Is there anything you can't do?<sp:0:4:0>You know, I'm set to be the head of this
village one day.<sp:0:4:0>I only hope I'm as good at solving
problems as you, our village's savior!
Talk_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>This was painted by <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>.
It's a keepsake my family—<sp:5:0:0>no, the whole
village—<sp:5:0:0>will pass down for generations!
Her depiction of <clr:0000>Lover's Pond <clr:ffff>renews
your belief in love, doesn't it?<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:5000>And yet, I'm still alone...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_1007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Welcome back! <sp:5:0:0>Rain or shine, there's
always lots to enjoy in Lurelin Village!
Talk_1030:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hey, the village savior! You're back!
You took a liking to Lurelin Village, huh?
Talk_1031:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hey, the village savior! Spending the night
in Lurelin Village?
Talk_1020:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Just looking at <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>'s painting
of <clr:0000>Lover's Pond<clr:ffff>, you can feel the special
power of the place itself.
Talk_1021:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The princess was quite fond of our little
village. She often came here, disguising
herself as a simple traveler.
It was during one of those visits that she
painted the picture of <clr:0000>Lover's Pond<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>You know, Kiana's <clr:0000>restaurant<clr:ffff> and
Chessica's <clr:0000>salt spa<clr:ffff> were both inspired
by Princess Zelda's ideas.
Really, we have her to thank for our
reputation as Hyrule's top vacation spot.
Talk_1022:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>It's a <clr:0000>pond<clr:ffff> on <clr:0000>Tuft Mountain<clr:ffff>, that big
mountain looming behind my house.<sp:0:4:0>There was a time when lots of folks went
there in hopes of finding true love.<sp:0:4:0>Then those <clr:0000>ring garlands<clr:ffff>, said to bring
people close together, started being sold
in a village somewhere.
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Now there are fewer and fewer visitors
to Lover's Pond.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>Still, Princess Zelda made her way out to
<clr:0000>Lover's Pond <clr:ffff>whenever she was in town.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>Only in the evening though... I'm not
sure why.
Talk_1010:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Scare_00>Ugh! Why did I come back for some stupid clothes?


This could make for a good story one day, I guess...<sp:5:0:0>
Though it won't be as funny if I die at the end.

If I whisper for help enough times, maybe someone
will hear me... <sp:5:0:0>Help...<sp:5:0:0> Help... <sp:5:0:0><sp:1:1:4:00000040>Help, help, help!<sp:1:1:4:0000803f><sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_1023:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>They say Princess Zelda is still missing,
but I'm sure she'll turn up soon enough.<sp:0:4:0>Exhausted too, no doubt. I hope she
comes back to our village to relax.
Talk_1011:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease_01>You want to hear something pathetic?
During the whole pirate raid, I was holed
up in my house, hiding.
After the evacuation, I'd snuck back to
grab a change of clothes.<sp:0:4:0>But before I knew it, there were pirates
outside! So I had no choice but to hunker
down and pray they didn't find me.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>If not for you, they probably would've
demolished my house with me in it.

You saved my life, and you helped me
come to an important realization...

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>An outfit isn't worth risking your life
for—<sp:5:0:0>no matter how good it makes your
legs look!
Talk_1024:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy>Want to see <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>'s painting of
<clr:0000>Lover's Pond<clr:ffff>? You can check it out in
my house!
It's a keepsake my family—<sp:5:0:0>no, the whole
village—<sp:5:0:0>will pass down for generations!
